action.action-desc: Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois (for himself and Mr. Raskin) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To increase the aggregate limitation on grants to low-income taxpayer clinics, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Low-Income Tax Clinic Modernization Act.

subsection.text: Section 7526(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subclause (I), by striking or at the end,
in subclause (II), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or, and
by adding at the end the following:

subclause.text: operates a program to provide technical advice and litigation support to programs described in subclauses (I) and (II).

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(i), by inserting (or such other percentage, not to exceed 400 percent, as established by the Secretary with respect to such clinic, provided that the Secretary has determined that such percentage will increase the ability of the clinic to represent additional taxpayers) after 250 percent.

subsection.text: Section 7526(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking $6,000,000 and inserting $20,000,000,
in paragraph (2), by striking $100,000 and inserting $500,000, and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Limitation on use of grants for overhead and administration
paragraph.text: With respect to any costs incurred by the institution sponsoring the low-income taxpayer clinic for general overhead and program administration, such costs shall not exceed 10 percent of the amount of any grant provided under this section with respect to such clinic.

subparagraph.text: In the case of any calendar year beginning after 2023, the dollar amounts in paragraphs (1) and (2) shall each be increased by an amount equal to—

clause.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting 2022 for 2016 in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof.

With respect to the dollar amount in paragraph (1), if such amount, as increased under subparagraph (A), is not a multiple of $500,000, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $500,000.

clause.header: Limitation on annual grants to a clinic
clause.text: With respect to the dollar amount in paragraph (2), if such amount, as increased under subparagraph (A), is not a multiple of $5,000, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $5,000.

subsection.text: Paragraph (5) of section 7526(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: Except as provided under subparagraph (B), with respect to any grant provided to a low-income taxpayer clinic under this section, such clinic shall provide matching funds equal to the applicable percentage of the amount of such grant.
The requirement under subparagraph (A) shall not apply to any low-income taxpayer clinic during its first 2 years of operation.

clause.text: For purposes of this paragraph, the term matching funds may include—

subclause.text: the salary (including fringe benefits) of individuals performing services for the low-income taxpayer clinic, and
the cost of equipment used in the low-income taxpayer clinic.

clause.text: For purposes of this paragraph, the term matching funds shall not include any indirect expenses, such as general overhead of the institution sponsoring the low-income taxpayer clinic.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the applicable percentage shall be 100 percent, except that the Secretary may establish a lower percentage (not below 50 percent) if the Secretary determines that such percentage would expand the coverage of the low-income taxpayer clinic to additional taxpayers.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to calendar years beginning after the date of enactment of this Act.
